intro: Tridactyle erectocalcarata, commonly known as the erect calcarate tridactyle, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and distinctive calcarate structures, which are calcified projections on the seed pods. The plant typically features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink or purple. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations in tropical environments.
